results.title: Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead
results.creator_credit: Tom Stoppard, Emanuel Azenberg, Michael Brandman, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Cinecom Entertainment
results.brief_description: Let Richard Dreyfuss, Tim Roth and Gary Oldman take you one a medieval misadventure, getting themselves in and out of trouble to tell the “true” story (with a few hilarious distractions along the way) of one of the most famous stories of all time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Stoppard, Emanuel Azenberg, Michael Brandman, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Cinecom Entertainment

results.title: Rosemary's baby [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, William Castle and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A glossy, psychological horror thriller based on Ira Levin’s best seller of the power of witchcraft to destroy lives. Rosemary (Mia Farrow) is the unsuspecting wife whose actor husband (John Cassavetes) becomes involved with a witches coven. Rosemary’s pregnancy precipitates sinister happenings and she soon discovers that not even Dr. Sapirstein (Ralph Bellamy), a respected obstetrician is to be trusted. Sidney Blackmer and Ruth Gordon (who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her performance) are the ghastly neighbours with diabolical designs on Rosemary’s infant. “Rosemary’s Baby” plays on fears even more potent and atavistic than “Psycho.” Co-starring Maurice Evans, Angela Dorian and Patsy Kelly.

results.title: Roseland
results.creator_credit: Octavio Iturbe, Wim Vandekeybus, Walter Verdin, Twin Cities Public Television, Audiovisuele Dienst K U Leuven and Alive From Off Center, VRT, Ultima Vez and Beeldhuis
results.brief_description: Ultima Vez is a dance company formed by director, choreographer, actor and photographer Wim Vandekeybus in 1985. This dance video, made from the material of Vandekeybus’ first three choreographies with the company, places these performances in the remarkable setting of a dilapidated Brussels cinema which had been abandoned for the past twenty years. Using a range of cinematic techniques, the film radiates a particular fascination of its own, transforming the theatrical energy of the stage choreography into a dynamic screen experience. For more information go to http://www.ultimavez.com/
results.creator_credit_for_label: Octavio Iturbe, Wim Vandekeybus, Walter Verdin, Twin Cities Public Television, Audiovisuele Dienst K U Leuven and Alive From Off Center, VRT, Ultima Vez and Beeldhuis

results.title: Rose Marie
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke, Hunt Stromberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A movie rendition of the Rudolf Friml/Herbert Stothart operetta, ‘Rose Marie”, stars Jeanette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy. MacDonald is an opera singer whose brother, played by James Stewart, is an escaped convict wanted for murder. She follows him into the Rockies where she is romanced and serenaded by a handsome Canadian Mountie (Nelson Eddy). Actually filmed on location in the Rockies. The film includes many immortal melodies from the operetta as well as other songs and items from the operas Romeo and Juliet and Tosca. David Niven also appears briefly in the film which was refilmed in 1954.

results.title: Rose against the odds
results.creator_credit: John Dixon, Russell Kennedy, Ross Close and Onset Productions
results.brief_description: The fate of Australia’s most prominent Aboriginal boxer, Lionel Rose, is charted here in dramatic detail and enacted by Paul Williams. Roses’ career culminated in 1968 when the then unknown 19 year old became world bantamweight champion. His success made him a household name and national hero with people from all walks of life. It was not a path paved in gold however, as battles with alcohol would mar his ultimately triumphant life. Cast also includes Telly Savalas, Tsurutaro, Kris McQuade, Tony Barry, Vicki Blanche and Steve Jacobs.

results.title: Rose's house
results.creator_credit: Clay Borris and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film takes an unvarnished look at life in a working-class district of Toronto. Based on the filmmaker’s memories of his mother’s boarding house in Cabbagetown, Toronto, this docudrama revolves around Rose and how she runs her establishment. With a household as full and varied as hers, where the marginal mix with the straight, situations arise that require immediate action. For bootlegging, violence, and stealing, Rose hands out her own brand of justice. Even authority isn’t exempt: she becomes involved in a noisy dispute with a social worker over her son’s theft of a bicycle. Cast: Rose Maltais-Borris, Albert Borris, Ronald Maltais, Garry Borris, John Brown, Magella Joseph, George Martell, Paulette Jiles, Edmond Charest.

results.title: Rosanna: a portrait of an immigrant woman
results.creator_credit: Sharon McGowan, Shelah Reljic and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Rosanna Santamaria arrived in Canada in 1969. A single parent supporting three children, she had to adapt to a new marital status, a new country, and a new language. Although she faced added difficulties as an immigrant, her problems are common to many women. She is now working to help others like herself make the transition to a new life.

results.title: Rosalie's journey
results.brief_description: The film presents Rosalie (Ngarla) Kunoth-Monks speaking for the first time in her Arrente language. It tells the other side to the film which in 1955 was one of a kind: first full colour feature film and first to feature Aboriginal actors with speaking parts. The program is about Rosalie’s life before and after ‘Jedda’, her life in central Australia as a young woman and the profound cultural challenges she faced when selected by Charles Chauvel to play the lead role in ‘Jedda’ in 1955. Includes archival footage and excerpts from ‘Jedda’ including some b&w scenes.

results.title: Rosalie
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke, William Anthony McGuire and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A rich and lively blend of great songs, great dances, great comedy and plain old period charm, Rosalie is the kind of zany musical they just don’t make anymore. Starring Nelson Eddy as Dick Thorpe, star footballer and West Point cadet and Eleanor Powell as Rosalie, the woman he loves. Cast also includes Frank Morgan, Edna May Oliver, Ray Bolger, Ilona Massey with words and music by Cole Porter. Based on the play by William Anthony McGuire and Guy Bolton. The film is introduced by Bill Collins.

results.title: Rope [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Transatlantic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: John Dall and Farley Granger play flat mates (and implied homosexual lovers) who strangle a friend for intellectual thrills and proceed to invite the victim’s family and friends for dinner, believing they have committed the perfect crime. Their former teacher, James Stewart, suspects wrongdoing and by the end of the evening discovers how brutally his students have twisted his own academic theories to justify the murder. Also Stars Sir Cedrick Hardwicke and Constance Collier. Adapted by Hume Cronyn form the play by Patrick Hamilton play that dealt with the Leopold-Loeb murder trial. Screenplay by Arthur Laurents. Cinematography by Joseph Valentine and William V. Skall.
